instruction: Explain why behavioral scientists overestimate the effectiveness of nudges and other psychological phenomena.
output: Behavioral scientists are experts in their field and have a deep understanding of the principles of behavioral science. However, this expertise can sometimes lead to overconfidence in their ability to predict the effectiveness of nudges and other psychological interventions. This overconfidence can result in an overestimation of the impact of these interventions, leading to biased predictions. Additionally, behavioral scientists may be influenced by their own beliefs and values, which can further contribute to an overestimation of the effectiveness of nudges and other psychological phenomena.
